results.title: Common fallacies about group differences
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
A painter working in a classroom makes a statement about the French race and Latin temperament. A professor, over-hearing his remark, tries to correct his misconceptions. Among other facts, he points out that a nation is not a race, that members of a group are never “all anything”, that group behaviour cannot be judged by isolated cases.

group_siblings.title: The Brain and behavior

results.title: The Brain and behavior
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
Demonstrates two ways in which the function of different brain areas can be studied. One method is to stimulate different parts of the living brain with an electrode. The other is to measure the changes in behaviour following injuries to different areas of the brain.

group_works.title: Conservation tillage protecting our greatest asset

results.title: Conservation tillage protecting our greatest asset
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Protecting Our Greatest Asset”.
It should be noted that this video is made by a chemical company that manufactures herbicides. Intensive cropping and continual cultivation stresses the Australian soil dramatically. This video looks at alternative methods to soil tillage by machinery, namely herbicides. Crops which require no tillage as conservation are also discussed.

results.title: Problems of conservation
results.brief_description: Highlights problems in the United States associated with the depletion of non-renewable natural resources; forest, mineral, wildlife and the associated problem of increasing air pollution. Discusses intervention strategies.

results.title: Problem of conservation: Our natural resources
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in crisis: problems of conservation”.
Provides a broad overview of developing crises in world natural resources. Establishes man’s reliance upon and misuse of such resources and describes current conservation efforts. Produced in collaboration with Allan A. Sollers, author of “Ours is our Earth.”

results.title: Soil
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in crisis: problems of conservation”.
Shows what soil is and how it is formed - then illustrates the damaging effects of water and wind erosion. Another damaging depletion is the loss of nutrients in the soil. Illustrates with on the spot examples of how the U.S. conservation service in 1969 combated these projects that range from contour ploughing to land use planning.

results.title: Water
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems of conservation”
Shows innovative ways to increase water supplies - percolation ponds, desalination of salt water, artificial weather control. Indicates that pollution control is equally important in conserving and purifying present water supplies.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Wildlife
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in crisis: problems of conservation”.
Explains the need for conservation of wildlife in order to preserve the ecological balance of nature. Describes the endangered status of many species today, what has been done to control impending extinction in the past, and what can be done in the future through refuges. In collaboration with Allan A. Sollers, author of “Ours is the Earth”.

results.title: Minerals
results.creator_credit: Bill Erwin, John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in crisis: problems of conservation”.
Introduces a variety of mineral resources vital to our present way of life. Emphasises that many of these resources are non-renewable and shows current efforts directed towards conserving mineral resources.
